intro: Mascagnia complicata, commonly known as the Florida moccasin vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves, and its stems are woody and tend to climb or trail. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Mascagnia complicata is also notable for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal medicine.
